com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.emu

Class SenderAwareConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.emu.SenderAwareConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection, IConfigurable, IRegisterable, Serializable

    public class SenderAwareConnection
extends Object
implements Connection
    A Connection filter that can look ahead to find the SenderCompID of the connecting party before returning any data. The data that is read during the look-ahead is buffered and returned through normal calls to the InputStream returned by this class's getInputStream() method. This allows the connecting party's SenderCompID to be determined before passing the SenderAwareConnection to a Session constructor. It is therefore possible to assign a Persister according to the connecting party's SenderCompID. All of the Connection's data is available for reading via the Session's normal protocol, yet we have been able to look ahead at the SenderCompID in the Logon message before passing the Connection to a Session.
    Author:
    Christopher J Burton, 15/Sep/2005.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getSenderCompID

        public String getSenderCompID()
                       throws IOException
        Returns:
        the SenderCompID of the connecting party. The InputStream of the underlying Connection is read until the SenderCompID can be determined and the data read is buffered so that it can later be returned from normal read methods called on the InputStream returned by this SenderAwareConnection's getInputStream method.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs when reading

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the SenderAwareConnection by closing the underlying Connection.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Connection

      • getInputStream

        public InputStream getInputStream()
                           throws IOException
        Returns an InputStream that will provide the data from the underlying Connection's InputStream as if it had not been touched by us. The data that we initially read to determine the connecting party's CompID will first be returned, then anything that we have not yet read. Note that we must implement the int read( byte[] b, int offset, int length ) method, since the parent class's default implementation blocks when the buffer cannot immediately be filled to the requested length. Our implementation will return what we can, blocking only for the first byte.
        Specified by:
        getInputStream in interface Connection
        Returns:
        the connection's input stream
        Throws:
        IOException - TBD

      • configure

        public void configure(IConfiguration configuration)
               throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Apply the IConfiguration to this IConfigurable.

        This method is called by the configuration module in the server:

        • when loading the configuration at server startup (e.g. when reading the XML configuration file) and
        • every time we reload the configuration object corresponding to the configurable run-time object.
        The Catalys Server passes a reference to a configuration clone. The original reference is unavailable to the configurable object. The configurable object may decide to store the reference as the last valid configuration object which can be used to optimize the re-configuration.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface IConfigurable
        Parameters:
        configuration - the immutable configuration object
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - This exception is thrown when the new configuration object cannot be applied to the configurable object.
